== Main Inclusion Report for arora ==

=== Requirements ===

# ''Availability:'' <nowiki>[[http://archive.ubuntu.com/ubuntu/pool/universe/a/arora]]</nowiki>; available for all supported architecture
# ''Rationale:''
** Wanted for Kubuntu
 0. ''Security:''
** <nowiki>[[http://cve.mitre.org/cgi-bin/cvekey.cgi?keyword=arora|CVE entries]]</nowiki>: None
** <nowiki>[[http://secunia.com/search/?search=arora|Secunia history]]</nowiki>: None
** No binaries running as root or suid/sgid.  No daemons
** Network activity: doesn't open port.  Uses QtWebKit to process incoming network data
** Does not directly (not through a library) process binary (video, audio, etc) or structured (PDF, etc) data
** No known source code review performed
 0. ''Quality assurance:''
** Always works out the box
** No debconf questions
** <nowiki>[[http://bugs.debian.org/src:arora|Debian bugs]]</nowiki>: few
** <nowiki>[[http://packages.qa.debian.org/a/arora.html|Maintenance in Debian]]</nowiki> is vigorous
** <nowiki>[[http://www.arora-browser.org|Upstream]]</nowiki> is frenetic
** <nowiki>[[http://code.google.com/p/arora/issues/list|Upstream bug tracker]]</nowiki>: (mention any particularly relevant or critical)
** Hardware: n/a
** No test suite
 0. ''UI standards:''
** User-visible strings are internationalized using Qt
** Package with translatable strings does not build a PO template during package build
** End-user application ships a desktop file
 0. ''Standards compliance:'' 
** <nowiki>[[http://www.pathname.com/fhs/|FHS]]</nowiki>, <nowiki>[[http://www.de.debian.org/doc/debian-policy/|Debian Policy]]</nowiki> compliant
** Packaging system debhelper  Patch system: quilt
 0. ''Dependencies:''
** Qt
** All in main
 0. ''Maintenance:''
** Minimal maintenance needed
** Kubuntu packagers will monitor the quality
 0. ''Background information:''
** The general purpose and context of the package is clear from the package's debian/control file.
** Upstream call it Arora, was previously demo browser
